website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive deep-fry thermometer that works well for some, but isn't the best quality.
pros: Easy-to-read temperatures and made out of stainless steel with a clip attachment to hold the thermometer in place
cons: The temperature readings aren't always super accurate

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for me.
customer_reviews.text: I have just started making jam and soon realized that a thermometer would make the process easier. This one looks a bit old fashioned but works well. The clip is not all that easy to use but I managed okay. I can't attest to the accuracy, but the jam did jellify correctly so it is probably about right.
customer_reviews.author: JemimaP

customer_reviews.title: its huge
customer_reviews.text: Good quality but much much bigger than expected. Youll need a fair bit of product in the pan before it will reach the scale
customer_reviews.author: Cressi

customer_reviews.title: Essential when deep frying.
customer_reviews.text: A sturdy, well made thermometer which now prevents me overheating the frying oil. Easy to clean and store.
customer_reviews.author: George A. Nott

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: you can move the holder to wear you want it in the pan
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Myles

customer_reviews.title: Polder Products Candy/Jelly/Deep Fry Thermometer....
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what you would expect it to do. Quality product....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great on gas hob, gives correct temp for two stage chip frying
customer_reviews.text: Clip does not hold it very well to side of chip pan. Gives a good indication of different temperatures required to make homemade chips.
customer_reviews.author: phil wilson, cumbria

customer_reviews.title: Take the guesswork out of making jam, fudge, toffee, marshmallows...
customer_reviews.text: Takes the guesswork out of making jam, fudge, toffee and marshmallows. Much easier than dropping mix into cold water to test readiness. Would buy again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: sooang

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected and very resilient. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ginja

customer_reviews.title: ... jam and candy making with this it is very easy to read
customer_reviews.text: looking forward to jam and candy making with this it is very easy to read
customer_reviews.author: Lorna Leek

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed, only used once and it broke!! Very unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: Aroon karim

customer_reviews.title: not secure
customer_reviews.text: Tried to secure this to pan was wobbling about and then it fell off onto the floor and broke before it was even used Terrible design
customer_reviews.author: LEDGARD JEPSON LTD

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this item
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend this item,well made with a clip to secure it to saucepan
customer_reviews.author: Bryn

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and clipped well onto side of pan. Easy to read and with handy sugar craft stages marked on the scale. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: HELENA BEVAN

customer_reviews.title: Cooking is better as a result
customer_reviews.text: Clips well to the side of my pan and provides accurate temperature readings. Deep frying is significantly easier when I know exactly how hot the oil is, and significantly eases regulating temperature. Cooking is better as a result, as I no longer have to guess how hot the oil is, meaning I no longer over- or under-do it.
customer_reviews.author: Nick F

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I can now make fluff instead of buying a pot at £2.00 or £3.00
customer_reviews.author: Kitchensink

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Looks a good sturdy product arrived as usual on time and well packaged.
customer_reviews.author: Jane McDowall

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product and good price very fast delivery. Perfect 😊
customer_reviews.author: Bubble hut

customer_reviews.title: Must have kitchen tool for bakers/candy makers.
customer_reviews.text: I love this for making macarons, boiling sugar, chocolate, etc. Just be sure to clean it right after using it with a warm cloth or paper towel in order to prevent the sugar, etc., from becoming hard after use. I've attached pictures of desserts I'm made using this.
customer_reviews.author: Oby N

customer_reviews.title: Broke within a month.
customer_reviews.text: I was in love with this thermometer! I only used it a few times over the course of a month, and within that time, it stopped working. It has been stuck at the same temp of 188•F regardless of what I’ve tried. I’m so disappointed, because this product worked great up until that point.
customer_reviews.author: C. Killeen

customer_reviews.title: Bought the same version when me old one went out, dependable and consistent on temps
customer_reviews.text: I actually just threw out my old thermometer that was the same version that i had for YEARS because it was giving me problems, but it lasted so long and i got so many uses out of it that i just re bought it again. It works great, the only thing id say is dont throw the whole thermometer fully submerged in water or the dishwasher, I think thats where i went wrong. if you have stuck on candy/caramel on it just clip it to the side of a pot and boil with some vinegar and water, itll get most of it off and wipe the rest down.
customer_reviews.author: MarieTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: So much more stable!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! At first I thought MAN that's a big thermometer! But I I'm using it for the first time to make hard candy for Christmas! I am loving how stable it sits in the pan! I don't have to worry about it falling in like the older version. I also appreciate the larger thermometer numbers very easy to read! First time using it so far so good! Plan on ordering a second and throwing out my old school thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: marinewife

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE....not so much~ Good one!
customer_reviews.text: Update! I have had this for 9 months and it worked great...until it didn't! The mercury has already 'broken', as in the inside of the bulb has mercury in three different places! I tested it in hot water to see if it would fix itself or if it read the correct temp. Nope! It is worthless to me now. It helped me make the best fudge ever....but now I can't rely on it. Really nice and sturdy. I like that you don't have to clip it to the side of the pan. The tip of the thermometer doesn't go all the way to the bottom so you can just lay it in there propped up, not clipped.
customer_reviews.author: KT@AmazonFan

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: Received thermometer last Nov 2018. At Xmas time we made 3 batches of caramels and it worked great. Thermometer was put away (stored in our pantry) until Xmas this year and it worked for 2 batches of caramels and on the third one it would not read the temperature. Fortunately we had another thermometer and was able to save the batch of caramels. I tried to test the thermometer using boiling water and it was reading about 80 F high. I see the time to return this item has expired, so I guess we are out of luck.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: and they keep going in the garbage. This gets to 220 degrees
customer_reviews.text: I keep buying candy thermometers, and they keep going in the garbage. This gets to 220 degrees, and stays there..forever. No matter how my sugar is caramelizing....220, 220, 220. This is a piece of crap. Someone, PLEASE make a candy thermometer that is calibrated properly and is ACCURATE. Please. I'll pay good money. I swear.
customer_reviews.author: Baker Girl

customer_reviews.title: Pass
customer_reviews.text: I love this type of candy thermometer. The clip on the side hold it to the pan and the sugar stages are clearly marked. On first use, this didn’t go past 145°. When I thought the fudge had been cooking long enough, I checked the temp with a different thermometer which read 255°. Sending this back. Perhaps it fit for banged in shipping as it was shipped in a soft envelope instead of a box.
customer_reviews.author: Chef Direct Services

customer_reviews.title: Broke after just a few uses
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to get this thermometer, as I've just started experimenting with deep frying. I've used it a few times with decent results, however, after just 2 months (and 4 or 5 uses), the bulb at the bottom broke and the liquid came out. I am so very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Hennnnnnnnnigann

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: Inaccurate, do not buy. I used a couple of times in an effort to make candy and almost burned each time. Luckily I have a digital instant read and was able to save one of the recipes in time. Was about 20 degrees off!
customer_reviews.author: Sailor

customer_reviews.title: Much larger than I thought it would be! Lol
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says it’ll do; however, I guess I didn’t read the dimensions on this thing. I just saw that it can be used in candy making and I was going to it for measuring the temp of donut glazes... This thing is nearly 12” tall! Lol. It definitely is sturdy but I was actually looking for one much smaller that would fit into a small sauce pan rather than a large kitchen pot. It pays to read all the specs on what you buy, but I’m going to go ahead and keep it.
customer_reviews.author: ketoliciouseats

customer_reviews.title: Works well for large quantities
customer_reviews.text: I really like this thermometer because it is really good looking and has a convenient clip so it can be clipped to the rims of different pans, but if the pan has less than an inch of substance in it, the tip of the thermometer will not be submerged in whatever it is you are trying to cook. I was using a small recipe to make lollipops and the batch was small so I had to fight with the thermometer to get a temp reading on such a small amount of liquid. For larger quantities it is great, but I would get something smaller if you are looking to use it for smaller batches.
customer_reviews.author: J_Thill

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Only thing I like about this candy thermometer is that it is accurate. But it slides down pan and hits the bottom, so I had to hold it up and stir when I was getting close to desired temperature. And when making peanut brittle the peanuts got stuck in it!!!! It will be a backup, at best..... going out tomorrow to buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Dive Girl

customer_reviews.title: Temp wrong after a few months
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly for 5 months of fairly regular use, and then suddenly this last week my candy making started having issues. I figured it was me, screwing something up. Couldn't pinpoint what was going wrong until I decided to test the thermometer by putting it in a pot of water and bringing it to a boil. It was at a full rolling boil at 90C. A few degrees difference may not matter much if you're using it as a deep fryer thermometer, (I don't know, I don't use it for that) but for candy making, the temperature has to be exact. It's really annoying to have to replace thermometers 2-3 times a year.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne

customer_reviews.title: Totally Badass!
customer_reviews.text: Throw away your old round plastic thermometer; you know, the one that keeps rolling off the edge of the pan into your syrup or hot oil, and you have to fish it out with tongs and throw away because it melted ? Yeah, that one. Throw it away right this minute and buy this Polder thermometer. It clips to the damn side of the pan!! And, it's stainless steel, so if you are seriously clumsy and it does fall in the fat, you can fish it out a lot easier with that large handle to aim for. I bought two. Seriously, a no brainer.
customer_reviews.author: GDawg

customer_reviews.title: Love it, but be VERY cautious with the bottom bulb of the thermometer
customer_reviews.text: I love this thermometer except for one thing. The glass bulb at the bottom of the thermometer is not protected. You have to be extremely cautious when cleaning it, or pretty much doing anything with it. I can entirely see how the glass part of thermometer could easily be broken. I love everything else about it though, so I am just crazy careful with it when washing it or setting it down after removing it from the pan.
customer_reviews.author: Kim G.

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate.
customer_reviews.text: Inaccurate. I tried readings in multiple water sources while verifying with my instant read thermometer and it's not accurate. Water at a rolling boil never even made it up to 210° and Amazon is saying I can't return it because it contains hazardous liquid. Garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffancy

customer_reviews.title: Not at all accurate
customer_reviews.text: I've been making sugar syrup, but by the time this gets to the appropriate 118 degrees C it's completely crystallized, even without stirring or anything. The reads are not at all accurate, I'd say off by at least 10 degrees. Works well at low temperatures, but don't buy this if you need an accurate high temperature while making candies or pastry.
customer_reviews.author: A.J

customer_reviews.title: This thermometer is working well for me.  I recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 deep fat fryers. One has a preset temperature, just the one temperature, but it's nice to know that this temperature is in fact appropriate for most applicaitons. The other fryer has multiple settings and it's important to know the temperature achieved at a given setting. This thermometer is just the right size to stand in either of my fryers, so it convenient to use. Plus, it's got the right scale (90°F to 400°F - 30°C to 200°C) for deep fat frying. This thermometer is working well for me. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking everywhere for an accurate thermometer for my candy making. I thought with some decent reviews i would take a chance. NOPE, I first received it and at boiling water it was 7 degrees off. so I thought I would adjust my cooking time and read it higher, later. I made some candy and noticed it was getting dark quickly, even though my temp was reading 260 when i need 300. I ruined my candy... over 40 degrees off!! Not using this piece of junk ever again! Buyers Beware!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DONT BYT THIS THERMOMETER!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thermometer for candy making, since it clips onto the pot. I was making a batch of caramel and could see that the caramel was looking like it was close to being ready. This Polder Thermometer seemed to stay at 232* and so I checked with a digital thermometer and it was ready, saying 250*!! Almost ruined my batch. Piece of junk. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bevbstylin

customer_reviews.title: Has a Handy Clip!
customer_reviews.text: Got this one for canning, but I've expanded to using it for pasteurizing egg whites for buttercream as well. The thermometer has a sliding clip on the back so you just stick it on the pot, slide it to the height you want and you're good to go. The thermometer bulb is suspended a couple mm from the bottom of the metal plate, so you can push it against the bottom of the pan and not worry about blowing the bulb with direct heat. It also has handy markings which tick off the various candy states if that's what you want it for. Cleaning is a breeze since I just toss it in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: vanessa eiroa

customer_reviews.title: It works with some caveats
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for making caramels. It is okay, but mine is off by 3-5 degrees which can cause issues. I use a pan with a flared lip and the clip will not work unless you have a straight-sided pan. Without being able to clip the thermometer to the pan, it falls over and with smaller pans can flip out of the pan and pose a burn hazard.
customer_reviews.author: Yaquina

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your dollars
customer_reviews.text: If I could give it a zero, I would. I used it once when I was making a homemade beauty product. The mechanism that clips it to the pan came off, so I tried to put it back on. The glass broke and cut my hand it two places! Very, very cheap and poorly made! Don't waste your dollars. Since my return window has passed, I can't even get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Zora

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great quality no frills item that I don't anticipate I will have to replace for a very long time. I have the best digital thermometer but never trusted it, found it was a pain to set it in a way which would utilize its many abilities, and its a hassle to get batteries. No fuss and great quality! Very large with a sturdy clip and you don't have to worry about the thermometer hitting the bottom of the pan and effecting your temperature since there is a metal piece on the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I'm really happy I finally have one of these so I know the right temp to fry food without burning or soaking in too much oil by having a temp too low. I chose this thermometer because it looked sleek, easy to use, and had the clip on the back. Did not disappoint, just wish it would clip onto all the pots I want it to. My pots are too short for it to stand upright to use the clip
customer_reviews.author: Rena-Rochelle Salvador

customer_reviews.title: Thermometer glass busted on third use..
customer_reviews.text: Seemed ok the first few uses frying wings. Got this to replace a thermometer we didn't trust, so not sure how accurate the temp was. Bottom of thermometer tube busted on the third use, leaking the red chemical into the oil/food. Tossed the batch of wings. Cannot recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: LiveFree

customer_reviews.title: Well Built, Accurate and Durable
customer_reviews.text: This is my third candy/fry thermometer, and the first non-digital I have purchased. This thing is built like a tank, is incredibly accurate, and easy to clean and is my go to thermometer for candymaking and frying.
customer_reviews.author: AZ Wildcat

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Thermometer is off by 30-40 degrees. My candy started caramelizing at a reading of 300. The same thing happened with my isomalt at a reading of 280. Absolutely ridiculous. Luckily I’ve been making hard crack candy log enough to know without a thermometer when to remove from heat. This was a complete waste of money. Listen to the reviews. They’re accurate
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with this product
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this product. It worked well, but on the second use, the tip broke off. It wasn't bumped or hit against anything. I was cleaning it and putting it back into the original packaging (to protect it, I thought), and it simply broke. I've used thermometers like this for years and bought this one to replace one that I had had for a long time. I'll have to do more research before I buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Broke on second use
customer_reviews.text: Used it once just fine, seemed to be working. Tried to use it a week later for the second time and the temperature didn't seem to be rising as it should be. Was watching it closely and it wasn't even near 300 degrees F, when it definitely should have been (was showing closer to 225 or 250). Heard a "pop" come from the pot and when I came back, I could see the red liquid spilling out. Pulled it out of the pot and washed it off in the sink and it completely emptied. Terrible quality.
customer_reviews.author: Marisa Hahn

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 4 uses
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it 4 times before it broke. Now I have to go out and buy a new one because I need to get my candy made in two days. Waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Triple Mom

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, safe, and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Finally, an accurate, immersible thermometer I can't break that is large enough to read, works with an inch of liquid, and stays put. In the real world buying something that does what is expected should be average. Having wasted time, money, and messed up cooking with others, I now realize that merely doing what is expected deserves five stars. I should also mention that some similar models have pretty sharp edges.
customer_reviews.author: Ryq, Tilter at Windmills

customer_reviews.title: Over complicated and hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: Purchase this four years ago, seems like a pretty simple device. The clip never really did a great job hanging onto the side of the pot. I could never get the bottom clean with any amount of scrubbing. 4 years later and I have an air bubble, see picture
customer_reviews.author: OneDomino

customer_reviews.title: Love it, so far!!!
customer_reviews.text: So far, I am totally happy with my thermometer. Various uses, such as for candy making, jelly making,and deep frying, etc. Made of stainless steel, easy to use. I've had the glass thermometer, which didn't register the temp correctly. I used this product for candy making for Christmas and thus far, love it. Presents as stated by the manufacturer. Very pleased thus far.
customer_reviews.author: April Renn/AprilR

customer_reviews.title: A bit disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This item works well but when it arrived the clip that holds it to the pot was not attached well and I had to adjust it to make it fit right on the pot and not slide down. This might sound like a small thing, but it wasn't easy to do. But once I got that corrected it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Important! check the calibration
customer_reviews.text: It's off not the right temps. It's 8 to 13 degrees off. I've burned two batches of candy.
customer_reviews.author: Trinity

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: The product stuck to the side of our wax meltedlr perfectly, and let us have an easy accurate temperature reading of the melting wax. It can be a little difficult to read as the narrow opening of our wax melter doesn't give a great angle, but this is not a fault of the product, simply something to keep in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Ben K

customer_reviews.title: design flaw / completely unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Accuracy is essential for candy making and this thermometer cannot be relied upon. The glass tube moves easily up and down (there is nothing keeping it from moving and no "stop" built into the design that would indicate the tube was in the correct position. As such, what the temperature reads is totally dependent on where the glass tube happens to be and there is enough movement in the thermometer that the temperature reading can vary by as much as 40 degrees F.
customer_reviews.author: T. Scott Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Huge Thermometer.  Tiny Clip.
customer_reviews.text: This is a huge thermometer, which is fine, except the clip, located at the top, is quite short, so it doesn't work in your small-to-average sized pans. You have to manually stand the thermometer up, which is obviously a pain Works best if its primary use is for deep frying or you own your own candy company.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Michaels

customer_reviews.title: great customer service... bad product
customer_reviews.text: It starts off perfect but becomes inaccurate in less than a month. The mercury starts to spread making it impossible to make hard crack. They replaced the first one but it did the same thing
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Mars

customer_reviews.title: Nice Candy thermometer
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice sturdy thermometer for making candy. I am to get my candy to 138 degrees which is a little hard to get to but is marked as soft ball stage. I believe what I really need is a digital one. It does have several candy stages on it which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: lizsdogcooper

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Just after a few uses this thing just broke up, and when I try to contact for refund they says is not possible to return it.
customer_reviews.author: lauri

customer_reviews.title: Sweet :)
customer_reviews.text: Super convenient-- candy stages are delineated right on the thermometer by their respective temp. This is not a point against, totally on me and I have no idea if this is just a thing with candy thermometers (this is my first one, bought for making perfect pot de creme, haha) but this thing I HUGE which I didn't expect/check.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable but difficult to clean
customer_reviews.text: I was pleased with my initial use of this thermometer. I liked the feel of it, and it seemed to work well. What I was not happy with was soon after we started using it, we noticed more and more how hard it was to get it clean. And then, through really washing it, the numbers also washed off. A thermometer with no numbers to tell the temperature is not worth much. I won't be buying another one like this.
customer_reviews.author: allofakindmom

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: The thermometer slides around in the holder and the clip won't fit my pot. There was an air bubble in it when i got it, too. To fix that, my hubby put it in the freezer for a few minutes. We stood it up and let it come back to room temperature and got rid of that.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Candy Candy Candy
customer_reviews.text: Candy making is not the easiest process, but I've used this thermometer to make fudge, marshmallows, and so much more successfully. I've been very happy with its quality and durability. The only downside is having to clean it, but the successful candies I make with it are worth the work.
customer_reviews.author: Skyler

customer_reviews.title: Essential for any candymaker
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to make pralines and knew I would need a good candy thermometer. This one was perfect. The thermometer clips to the side of the pot and is far enough away from the bottom of the pot so the burner heat doesn’t affect the temperature reading. Pralines came out perfect, and it was all about getting the candy temperature right.
customer_reviews.author: Scarlett Flowers

customer_reviews.title: Good as it's weak link
customer_reviews.text: Product has an adjustable clip to hold to side of boiler. Clip popped off immediately and mfg must have used a special tool to put it on because no one near me can restore/repair it. The only reason I purchased this product was the clip...rendering the product virtually useless/unnecessary for me as I already have 2 instant reads.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until it didn't.
customer_reviews.text: I have used my thermometer about 10 times. When I was using it today I noticed the red "mercury" indicating the temperature had separated. I don't know if the top part is showing the correct temperature or if it's the lower mark or somewhere in between. ARGH! I can't use it for candy anymore and need to buy a new one. I am not happy that it broke after so few uses. I have always hand washed it and treated it with care. Will not be buying another Polder thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah LeBuhn

customer_reviews.title: Thermometer is well made and appears to stand up over time.
customer_reviews.text: This Deep Fry Thermometer works very well. It is just dandy when melting bees wax. One needs to know the right temperature To put wax in boiling water to melt and then pour through strainer. The clean wax is used in bee frames or making candles.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Skinny

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother with this.
customer_reviews.text: It stopped working already. The red line in the thermometer doesn't move anymore. I wouldn't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Powellmoss

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap
customer_reviews.text: It broke the first time I used it, the red liquid spilled in the oil and there was broken glass on the food. Very dissapointed i couldn't eat the food which cost about $15 to make so $35 dollars lost which I can't get back.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Good Thermometer!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this thermometer as a replacement for one from Wal-Mart. The Wal-Mart thermometer broke when dropped on the floor. I needed something sturdier. Not only is it easier to use (stands on the pot leaving hands free), it is a little more robust.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ski

customer_reviews.title: LIES. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I was trying to make caramels and it was only reading up to 100 degrees F. It would not go any higher. So this caused the caramels to be ruined and overcooked. It is a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: jaren

customer_reviews.title: Hard to read.
customer_reviews.text: The red temperature gauge has some rogue lines that sit above the main line and it's hard to tell what the temperature is. The temperature didn't seem accurate either. It now sits in my drawer and I use a different thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Himes

customer_reviews.title: Broke during second use
customer_reviews.text: I loved this thermometer....the one time I was able to use it. While beginning to boil oil in a dutch oven for some beer battered onion rings (#quarantinefun) the tip of the thermometer seemingly exploded (sounds overly dramatic, but the bottom of the bulb cracked open and broke into several pieces ) while oil was preheating, and leaked out the red liquid (very jarring and blood like when you're not expecting it). There was nothing I did incorrectly, the oil wasn't even particularly hot at this point. It's just faulty
customer_reviews.author: Fallon Morrissey

customer_reviews.title: Finally a good one!
customer_reviews.text: I have cooked for nearly 50 years, starting at the age of 7, and have tried a multitude of thermometers over the years. Either the wouldn't stay hooked on the side of the pan and I'd have to try to hold them to get a reading, or they're just plainly not register the correct temperature. So happy I finally found this one as it works perfectly for candy and deep frying. This product is study and easy to use with my cook wear. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: AZ Lady

customer_reviews.title: Fits any pot
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always wanted a the thermometer that I could fit on a pot. This gadget fits multi sized pots. It’s easy to adjust and clean. I used it to heat milk for yogurt. Next challenge will be fudge!
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: ...and then the numbers wiped off :(
customer_reviews.text: Worked at first, then the numbers rubbed off! I was really happy with this - I had purchased it for my yogurt making and the size was perfect for my pot. Unfortunately, the third time I used it some milk foam got stuck on the face so I wiped it off, with a damp paper towel, to read the degree —- and all the numbers & tics wiped off! Crazy that it couldn’t withhold 180 degrees without losing the finish. It’s basically useless now.
customer_reviews.author: Sedef

customer_reviews.title: a must for frying
customer_reviews.text: You really cannot guess how hot the oil is for frying...a must kitchen tool
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Right temperature
customer_reviews.text: I was watching a cooking show on facebook and the chef was using this (along with another meat thermometer). Had to buy! Never knew this type of thermometer existed just for frying among other things. Great that it clips onto the pot.
customer_reviews.author: Sami

customer_reviews.title: not accurate
customer_reviews.text: Used for making candy. Completely inaccurate, candy burned. Temperature seemed to go to a certain degree and stop rising on the thermometer, even though real temperature was getting hotter.
customer_reviews.author: blueberry eyes

customer_reviews.title: works good until it breaks
customer_reviews.text: This works really well at the beginning. It took me a moment to figure out how to use it and connect to the pan but once I did it worked good. At times it was a little hard to read. I originally liked this but it broke within a few uses.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Gallegos

customer_reviews.title: Welp...
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this an overall rating of 1 star because it shattered, while I was using it, for the first time. It kept temp accurate during the use. It was easy for me to attach to the pot I was using, but the glass shattered within 10 minutes. The contents of this thermometer entering the oil I was using to make blueberry fritters. I've never seen this happen with any thermometer before. I'm baffled.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Scratches non stick surface of new T-Fal skillet
customer_reviews.text: This is a unit that is stamped & formed of stainless steel to create the finished product. In doing so, the bottom of the gauge that rests in the skillet/pan scratches the non stick surface, even with very little movement. I use it to measure the temperature while making peanut brittle, so the temp never exceeds around 305 degrees F. A high temp silicone should be applied as a cushion during the manufacturing process to prevent scratches.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: A excellent and durable product! Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is AWESOME!! it is adjustable so the end doesn't touch the bottom of the pan..making reading the temp way more accurate. It's very big..and definitely durable! A great product!
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Vanderlinde

customer_reviews.title: What a piece of JUNK!
customer_reviews.text: OK it was a while before I used this piece of junk so it's way to late to return it. But the first time I even TRIED to use it, it never went over 200F. There went that batch of peanut brittle. Thanks for nothing.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy for deep frying
customer_reviews.text: After using this twice for deep frying, the heat from the oil (around 325° both times) flexed the metal to the point where the clip cannot hold it up anymore. Also, the mercury in the thermometer has dispersed and is no longer accurate. Do not buy this for frying.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Liebman

customer_reviews.title: Glad I finally bought this!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to make eggplant parm, and it was a long overdue kitchen purchase. Easy to use, only issue was the clip was too short for our le creuset but did have a problem using it with the high different. Can't wait to use it again!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great thermometer
customer_reviews.text: I used to use one of the cheapo non-digital ones. They take a long time to settle on the temperature. This thermometer is easy to read and gives you the temperature very quickly. The magnet on the back is also nice - I just stick it to the side of the fridge.
customer_reviews.author: Ka

customer_reviews.title: Broken!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived broken and isn’t available for return. This was a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra schumacher

customer_reviews.title: Beware - broke during second use
customer_reviews.text: I used this twice since purchasing. After the second time I noticed red dots inside the gauge and after closer look the bottom of the thermometer had broken off putting the contents in the oils. Concerned the Mercury got in the food we ate as we didn’t notice this until after we were cleaning up.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last
customer_reviews.text: When the product arrived the temperature indicator line was broken in spots, but it worked great. I used it three times, hand washed it each time. Then it stopped working. It registered boiling temperature after boiling had been reached and then never rose much above it even when passing the soft ball stage.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: This baby is real nice for the money. I bought it for deep frying in my pot but it has markings for candy making too. It looks like a professional instrument more than a kitchen tool. So far so great I used it to fry egg rolls my wife’s friend made and they were spot on. Can’t really speak to the longevity because I have only used it once, but cleanup is easy. Good purchase for me.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Meece

customer_reviews.title: Handy for fine tuning deep fry temps
customer_reviews.text: Never having used an actual thermometer for cooking before, buying this taught us that the *real* high setting on our stove is only about halfway. We'll never burn cheese curds again!
customer_reviews.author: Zac

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very solid product! The price was great, I've only used it a couple times but candy making season is approaching us, that will be the real test! But I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Numbers Rub Off
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this product a two star, instead of one, only because I loved the clip on the back. It stayed so nicely on the pot. However, I used the thermometer once - with a max temp of 185. After using a dishcloth to clean the thermometer I go to dry and realized all the numbers and lines indicating temperature had come off below 180 degrees. Def. a let down as the one time I used it, I really like it. Unfortunately, I can't use it for low thermometer cooking anymore - which is the main reason I bought it. Extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Hotalen

customer_reviews.title: Bubbles
customer_reviews.text: This thermometer is rated highly, and it is possible that it is a great thermometer. I bought one and started to use it and noticed a bubble in the lumen of the thermometer. I tried all of the recommended online fixes for this issue before I decided to return it and get another. The second one... had the same problem. I could deal with it if it would not have affected the temperature reading, but at cooler temperatures the bubble is smaller, as it warms up, the bubble gets larger. This is clearly not desirable when a few degrees means the difference between perfect fudge and a rock hard mess.
customer_reviews.author: ADK

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate Thermometer
customer_reviews.text: Works and looks great, It's much bigger than I thought it would be. 11 3/4" tall X 2" wide and the start of the thermometer is about a 1/4" from the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: MSH

customer_reviews.title: large but solid and accurate
customer_reviews.text: This is a quite massive thermometer. The glass bulb is well protected and, from the results, the temperature (from the results) seems accurate. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: It just didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to make maple syrup from sap. It just didn't work. Very disappointing, as once I started boiling my sap in end stages, I couldn't really stop the process. Had to guess when it was done.
customer_reviews.author: M. Young

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I make a lot of candy around the holidays. This is spot-on accurate and fits securely on the side of all my pots. Easy to remove, easy to read even when it's steamy. Washes easily too. It exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: R S
